algorithm_technique: Sort the array and use two pointers to find pairs that sum to the negative of the current element.
problem_summary_simple: Find all unique triplets in an array that sum up to zero.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate through sorted array, fix one element, and use two pointers to find the remaining two elements summing to the negative of the fixed element.
key_insights: Sorting is crucial for efficient duplicate handling and two-pointer approach.
Skipping duplicate elements at each step prevents duplicate triplets in the output.
The two-pointer approach efficiently searches for the remaining two numbers.
